projectDesc.p: The Göttingen Register of Electronic Texts in Indian Languages (GRETIL) is a resource platform providing standardized machine-readable texts in Indian languages that have been contributed by various individuals and institutions.

correction.p: Apparent errors have been silently corrected.

normalization.p: GRETIL normalizes all texts contributed consistently for each language. Sanskrit texts are normalized in accordance with the scheme of the International Alphabet of Sanskrit Transliteration (IAST) in order to facilitate word search across its corpus without additional transformations.

All characters that were fully equivalent to an IAST-conformant character in the text file contributed have been made to conform to the character list below. Non-conformant characters with additional information including accents, capitalization, and whitespace have been preserved as orig elements inside choice elements with their IAST-conformant equivalent in reg elements for the creation of a plain text. These additional informations will be available only in those transformations of this file that display the original information.

quotation.p: If indicated unambiguously in the text file contributed quotation marks have been replaced with the q element and, in case a reference was provided, have been nested inside a cit with the respective reference provided in a ref element after the quote.

segmentation.p: Unnumbered div elements are used to structure the text, using the type and n attributes in accordance with the refsDecl.

interpretation.p:
Interpretive markup which is visible only in analytic transformations of this file consists of:

Corruptions in sic elements,
Remarks in note elements with the @resp attribute identifying the agency.

body.p: Majumder, Prabhas Chandra (1959), Ārya Maitreya-vyākaraṇam, Calcutta (also published in Nalinaksha Dutt, Gilgit Manuscripts, vol. IV, Calcutta 1959, pp. xxix ff. and 185 ff., under P.C. Mazumder).

The first folios of the Skt. text containing verses 1-30 are missing.
All the sandhis are standardized.

lg.l: na niṣaṇṇā nipannā vā sthitā sā dharmacāriṇī /
pade pade nidhanaṃ ca padmaṃ padmaṃ bhaviṣyati //
iyaṃ me paścimā jātir nāsti bhūyaḥ punarbhavaḥ /
śvetaṃ cāsya surāś chattraṃ dhārayiṣyanti mūrdhani /
cintayiṣyati dharmātmā duḥkhitā khalv iyāṃ prajāḥ //
hastaḥ pañcāśad ucchrāya tasya kāyo bhaviṣyati /
taṃ ca ratnamayaṃ yūpaṃ dattamātraṃ manoramam /
yūpasya tasya maitreyo dṛṣṭvā caitām anityatām /
yatv ahaṃ pravrajitveha spṛśeyam amṛtaṃ padam /
aśītibhiḥ sahasraiḥ sa caturbhiś ca puraskṛtaḥ /
yasyām eva ca rātrau sa pravrajyāṃ niṣkramiṣyati /
tasyām eva ca rātrau hi parāṃ bodhim avāpsyati //
taṃ cāpi dharmaṃ saṃśrutya pratipatsyanti śāsane //
pūrṇaṃ ca yojanaśataṃ parṣat tasya bhaviṣyati //
śrutvā narapati rājā śaṅkho nāma mahāyaśāḥ /
tato gṛhapatis tatra sudhano nāma viśrutaḥ /
strīratnam atha śaṅkhasya viśākhā nāma viśrutā /
prāṇinaḥ tatra samaye sahasrāṇi śatāni ca /
kṛtvā stūpeṣu satkāram āgatā hi mamāntikam //
saṅghe dattvā ca dānāni cīvaraṃ pānabhojanam /
dattvā śākyamuneḥ stūpeṣv āgatā hi mamāntikam //
śīlāni ca samādāya saṃprāptāni ca śāsanam /
buddhaṃ dharmaṃ ca saṅghaṃ ca sattvās te śāsanaṃ gatāḥ /
kṛtvā ca kuśalaṃ karma macchāsanam upāgatāḥ //
tenaite preṣitāḥ sattvāḥ pratīṣṭāś ca mayāpy amī /
śrutvā ca te tato dharmaṃ prāpsyanti padam uttamam //
sarve te asravās tatra kṣipayiṣyanti suratāḥ //
tataḥ praviśatas tasyāṃ ramyāṃ ketumatīṃ purīm /
catvāraś ca mahārājāḥ śakraś ca tridaśādhipaḥ /
brahmā devagaṇaiḥ sārdhaṃ pūjāṃ tasya kariṣyati //
aguruṃ candanaṃ cāpi divyaṃ mālyaṃ patiṣyati //
divyaś ca tūryanirghoṣo divyaṃ mālyaṃ patiṣyati /
ye tu ketumatīṃ ke cid vāsayiṣyanti mānuṣāḥ /
te pi taṃ pūjayiṣyanti praviśantaṃ purottamam //
vicitraṃ ca śubhaṃ mālyaṃ vikiriṣyanti te tadā //
taṃ ca śakraḥ sahasrākṣo devarājaḥ śacīpatiḥ /
namas te puruṣājanya namas te puruṣottama /
ākīrṇā pṛthivī sarvā arhadbhiś ca bhaviṣyati /
śāstuḥ pūjāṃ kariṣyanti nāgāś cāpi maharddhikāḥ //
te vai nūnaṃ bhaviṣyanti cyānaghāś (?) chinnasaṃcayāḥ /
te vai pānaṃ gamiṣyanti chitvā jālam eva bhujāt /
śatāni ca sahasrāṇi prāṇinaṃ sa vināyakaḥ /
tasmiṃś ca nirvṛte dhīre maitreye dvipadottame /
tasmād dharme ca buddhe ca saṅghe cāpi gaṇottame /
idam āścaryakaṃ śrutvā dṛṣṭvā ca vibhavānalpikām /
ko vidvān na prasīdeta api kṛṣṇāsu jātiṣu //

body.p: Sylvain Lévi, "Maitreya le consolateur", Études d'orientalisme publiées par le Musée Guimet a la mémoire de Raymonde Linossier, Paris 1932, pp. 384-389

The first two folios of the Skt. text containing verses 1-25ab are missing.

body.p: Maitreyavyākaraṇaṃ samāptam // ye dharmā (etc.) // cīnadeśīvinirgataḥ bhikṣu puṇyakīrtir yad atra puṇyaṃ tad bhavatv ācāryopādhyāyamātāpitṛpūrvaṅgamaṃ krtvā sakalasattvarāśer anuttarajñānaphalāptaya iti // śrīmad gopāladevarājyasaṃvat 57 phālguna dine 9 Ghosalīgrāme likhati / oṃ hārītī mahāyakṣiṇī hara hara mama sarvapāpāni svāhā //

Ishigami, Zenno (1989), "Nepāru bon 'Maitreyavyākaraṇa'," Fujita Kḥtatsu Hakushi Kanreki Kinen Ronbunshū: Indotetsugaku to Bukkyḥ, Kyoto, 295-310.
To facilitate searching, sandhis are standardized, misprints removed, some mistakes corrected.

body.p:
iti maitreyavyākaraṇaṃ nāma mahāyānasūtraṃ samāptam /
ye dharmā hetuprabhavā hetu teṣāṃ tathāgato hy avadat /
teṣāṃ ca yo nirodha evaṃvādī mahāśramaṇaḥ //
śubham astu //
abdeglāvagnidvirade śita māghe guhānane /
pūṣāyāṃ pūṣṇadivase sarvvānanda samāpta kṛt //
